bracket.description: Refers to the country (if it exists) that is currently the Holy Roman Emperor. [Country]
Refers to the country (if it exists) that is the current revolution target. [Country]
Refers to the country (if it exists) that is the current crusade target. [Country]
Refers to the country (if it exists) that is the colonial parent of the current country scope. [Country]
Refers to the country (if it exists) that is the overlord of the current country scope. [Country]
Refers to the capital province of the current country scope. [Province]
Refers to the country that owns the current province scope. [Country]
Refers to the country that controls the current province scope. [Country]
Refers to the sea province on which the current land province scope has a port. [Province]
Refers to the area that the current province scope is in. [Province]
Refers to the region that the current province scope is in. [Province]
The country in the trade node that generates the most trade power from provinces. [Country]
The country with the most trade power in the node. [Country]
Scopes to all valid countries that meet the triggers in the limit. [Country]
Scopes to all members of the coalition against the current scope (if any). [Country]
Scopes to all countries in the world. Avoid this if you can use something more specific. [Country]
Scopes to all electors of the HRE. [Country]
Scopes to all valid countries that meet the triggers in the limit. [Country]
Scopes to all countries that have been discovered by the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to all valid countries that meet the triggers in the limit. [Country]
Scopes to all countries that share a border (or sea zone?) with the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to all valid countries that meet the triggers in the limit. [Country]
Scopes to all subject nations under the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to one valid country that meet the triggers in the limit. [Country]
Scopes to one random member of the coalition against the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to one random country among all countries in the world. Avoid this if you can use something more specific. [Country]
Scopes to one random elector of the HRE. [Country]
Scopes to one valid country that meet the triggers in the limit. [Country]
Scopes to one random country that has been discovered by the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to one valid country that meet the triggers in the limit. [Country]
Scopes to one random country that shares a border (or sea zone?) with the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to one valid country that meet the triggers in the limit. [Country]
Scopes to one random subject country under the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to all provinces that this country has a core on, whether owned or not. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces whose religion is heretic to the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces the current scope owns. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces in the world. Note: executing effects on every province without a limit will cause slowdown in game. Use something more specific if you can. [Province]
Scopes to one random province that the current scope has a core on, whether owned or not. [Province]
Scopes to one random province whose religion is heretic to the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to one valid area that meet the triggers in the limit. You can use type = all to scope to all valid areas. [Province]
Scopes to one random province the current scope owns. [Province]
Scopes to all trade nodes. [Province]
Scopes to one valid tradenode (province) that meet the triggers in the limit. Active means the current scope is interacting with the trade node in some way. [Province]
Scopes to one random trade node. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces sharing a border (or sea zone?) with the current scope that are colonizable and uncolonized. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces sharing a border (or sea zone?) with the current scope. Does not include empty provinces. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces in the same state (area?). [Province]
Scopes to one random province sharing a border (or sea zone?) with the current scope that is colonizable and uncolonized. [Province]
Scopes to one random province sharing a border(or sea zone?) with the current scope. Does not include empty provinces. [Province]
Scopes to one random province in the same state as the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to one random province among all provinces in the world. [Province]
Scopes to all countries that have a core on the current scope, whether existing or not. [Country]
Scopes to one random country that has a core on the current scope, whether existing or not. [Country]
Scopes to all provinces sharing a border (or sea zone?) with the current scope that are colonizable and uncolonized. [Province]
Scopes to all countries that are sending privateers to the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to one random country that is sending privateers to the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to all countries that own a province in the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to one random country that owns a province in the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to all provinces in the current trade node. [Province]
Scopes to one random province in the current trade node. [Province]
Returns the unit's owner country scope. Usable from on_battle_won_unit and on_battle_lost_unit on actions. [Country]
Scopes to all provinces among those specified as targets in the mission. [Province]
Scopes to one random province among those specified as targets in the mission. [Province]
Scopes to all armies currently fielded by the current scope. [Unit]
Scopes to all valid countries that meet the triggers. [Country]
Scopes to all members of the coalition against the current scope (if any). [Country]
Scopes to all countries in the world. Avoid this if you can use something more specific. [Country]
Scopes to all electors of the HRE [Country]
Scopes to all valid countries that meet the triggers. [Country]
Scopes to all countries that have been discovered by the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to all valid countries that meet the triggers. [Country]
Scopes to all countries that own a province that shares a border (or sea zone?) with a province owned by the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to all valid countries that meet the triggers. [Country]
Scopes to all subject countries under the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to all provinces that the current scope has a core on, whether owned or not. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces whose religion is heretic to the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces owned by the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces in the world. Avoid this if you can use something more specific. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces in states of the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to all states of the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to all active trade nodes. [Province]
Scopes to all trade nodes. [Province]
Scopes to one valid country that meet the triggers. [Country]
Scopes to one member of the coalition against the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to one country among all countries in the world. Avoid this if you can use something more specific. [Country]
Scopes to one elector of the HRE. [Country]
Scopes to one valid country that meet the triggers. [Country]
Scopes to one country that has been discovered by the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to one valid country that meet the triggers. [Country]
Scopes to one country sharing a border (or sea zone?) with the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to one valid country that meet the triggers. [Country]
Scopes to one subject country under the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to one province that the current scope has a core on, whether owned or not. [Province]
Scopes to one province whose religion is heretic to the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to one province owned by the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to one province among all provinces in the world. Avoid this if you can use something more specific. [Province]
Scopes to one state of the current country. [Province]
Scopes to one valid tradenode (province) that meet the triggers. Note: will return true if a merchant is placed, even without explicit triggers. [Province]
Scopes to one trade node among all trade nodes in the world. [Province]
Scopes to the trade node containing the current scope's main trade port. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces sharing a border (or sea zone?) with the current scope that are colonizable and uncolonized. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces in the same state as the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces sharing a border (or sea zone?) with the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces sharing a border (or sea zone?) with the current scope that are colonizable and uncolonized. [Province]
Scopes to one province sharing a border (or sea zone?) with the current scope that is colonizable and uncolonized. [Province]
Scopes to one province among all provinces in the world. Avoid this if you can use something more specific. [Province]
Scopes to one province in the same state as the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to one province that shares a border with the current scope that is friendly to the current scope (meaning its owner is the same or has positive relations). [Province]
Scopes to one province that shares a border (or sea zone?) with the current scope. [Province]
Scopes to all countries that have a core on the current scope, whether existing or not. [Country]
Scopes to all countries that have a core on the current scope, whether existing or not. [Country]
Scopes to all countries that are sending privateers to the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to all countries that own a province in the current trade node. [Country]
Scopes to one country that is sending privateers to the current scope. [Country]
Scopes to one country that owns a province in the current trade node. [Country]
Scopes to all" provinces in the current trade node. [Province]
Scopes to one province in the current trade node. [Province]
Scopes to all provinces specified as a target in the mission. [Province]
